alert.note: Alert for Philadelphia (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 2:08AM EST until January 10 at 8:30PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...Observed flooding changed to Minor severity for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Schuylkill River At Philadelphia near 30th Street affecting Philadelphia County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Schuylkill River at Philadelphia near 30th Street. * WHEN...Until this evening. * IMPACTS...At 5.0 feet, The river tops the bulkhead near Locust Street and begins to flood the grassy area between the river and the Schuylkill River Trail. The Schuylkill River Trail begins to flood between Cherry and Locust Streets (Lower portion of trail at the bottom of the steps). The bike and walking path in Bartram`s Garden near South 51st Street floods and becomes impassable. At 9.0 feet, Water tops the upper level of the Schuylkill River Trail between Market street and Chesnut Street as well as Cherry Street and Locust Street. At 9.5 feet, 25th Street and Locust Street floods as water flows across the Schuylkill River Trail. At 10.0 feet, South 24th Street floods between Ludlow Street and Armory Street. Train tracks adjacent to the Schuylkill River Trail flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:30 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 9.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 12:30 AM EST Wednesday was 9.6 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate around flood stage with a maximum value of 9.8 feet this afternoon. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 8.0 feet on 12/25/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (2 am) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Stg Time Date Schuylkill River Philadelphia ne 9.0 9.6 Wed 12 a 5.0 3.9 9.8 12pm 1/10 &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 215 PM EST.
